snippet: The New York Stock Exchange agreed to adopt new internal controls and pay a $5 million penalty to settle accusations that its trading data gave select clients a split-second advantage.
abstract: The New York Stock Exchange agreed to adopt new internal controls and pay a $5 million penalty to settle accusations that its trading data gave select clients a split-second advantage.

headline.main: New York Stock Exchange Settles Case Over Early Data Access
headline.print_headline: Big Board Settles Case Over Early Data Access
